intro: Senecio ovopedatus, commonly known as the woolly senecio, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its showy, daisy-like flowers. The plant is distinguished by its dense, woolly foliage, which gives it a unique, fluffy appearance. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. Senecio ovopedatus is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens due to its striking appearance and hardy nature.
